meanings.definition: A substance that imitates or simulates something else.
meanings.sent1: The fake snow was a simulant used in the movie scene.
meanings.sent2: The artificial sweetener is a simulant of sugar.
meanings.sent3: The simulant cheese looked so real that it fooled everyone at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a simulant of genuine happiness, hiding her true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The simulant diamond sparkled just like the real one, but at a fraction of the cost.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that simulates or imitates something else.
meanings.sent1: The robot was a simulant of a human, designed to perform tasks.
meanings.sent2: The parrot was a simulant, mimicking the sounds it heard.
meanings.sent3: The simulant of a famous singer performed at the talent show, fooling the judges.
meanings.sent4: His laughter was a simulant of joy, masking his inner sadness.
meanings.sent5: The simulant of a superhero costume made him feel invincible, even though he was just a regular person.
